dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 8583 IH: Lake Winnibigoshish Land Exchange Act of 2022
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Stauber (for himself and Mr. Huffman) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Agriculture to exchange certain public lands in Chippewa National Forest, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Lake Winnibigoshish Land Exchange Act of 2022.

paragraph.text: The term BWLT means Big Winnie Land and Timber, LLC, a Minnesota Limited Liability Corporation.
The term Federal land means the approximately 7.6 acres of Federal land generally depicted as the Federal Parcel for Exchange on the Map.
The term Map means sheets 2 and 3 of the map entitled Proposed Land Exchange - Bowen Lodge Inc. and Chippewa National Forest and dated March 30, 2022.
The term non-Federal land means the approximately 37.5 acres generally depicted as the non-Federal Parcel for Exchange on the Map.
The term Secretary means the Secretary of Agriculture.

subsection.text: Subject to the provisions of this Act, not later than 30 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, if BWLT offers to convey the non-Federal land to the United States, the Secretary shall—

paragraph.text: accept the offer and convey to BWLT all right, title, and interest of the United States in and to the Federal land; and
accept from BWLT all right, title, and interest of BWLT in and to the non-Federal land.

subsection.text: The exchange under subsection (a) shall be—

paragraph.text: subject to valid existing rights; and

if, under the appraisals conducted in accordance with this Act, it is determined that the value of the Federal land exceeds the value of the non-Federal land, conditioned on a cash equalization payment made by BWLT to the United States in accordance with subsection (c).
Except as provided in paragraph (2), the exchange under subsection (a) shall be for equal value or the values shall be equalized by a cash payment.

If the appraised value of the non-Federal land conveyed to the Secretary exceeds the appraised value of the Federal land, a cash equalization payment by the United States to BWLT is waived and the amount of such waived payment shall be considered a donation by BWLT to the United States for all purposes of law.
The value of the land to be exchanged under this Act shall be determined by appraisals conducted by one or more independent and qualified appraisers mutually agreed to by the Secretary and BWLT.
The Secretary shall complete an appraisal of the land to be exchanged under this Act in accordance with—

subparagraph.text: the Uniform Appraisal Standards for Federal Land Acquisitions; and
the Uniform Standards of Professional Appraisal Practice.

subsection.text: Title to the non-Federal land to be conveyed to the Secretary under this Act shall be in a format acceptable to the Secretary.
The land acquired by the Secretary under subsection (a) shall be—

paragraph.text: added to, and managed as part of, the Chippewa National Forest; and
managed in accordance with the laws, rules, and regulations pertaining to National Forest System lands.
As soon as practicable after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall finalize a Map and legal descriptions of all land to be conveyed under this Act.
In the case of a discrepancy between the Map and a legal description, the Map shall control.
The Secretary and BWLT, by mutual agreement, may correct any minor errors in the Map or in the legal descriptions.
The Map and legal descriptions shall be on file and available for public inspection in appropriate offices of the Forest Service.
